intro: Cymopterus thapsoides, commonly known as the silverleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and it produces a distinctive, pungent odor. Silverleaf tansy is typically found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils.
